title: Caving & Climbing Weekend
tagline: Go underground and vertical in the Beacons
suitableFor: Experienced adventurers and thrill-seekers with a good level of fitness and a head for heights and enclosed spaces. Those comfortable with challenging physical activity and unpredictable weather.
notSuitableFor: Those with claustrophobia, fear of heights, limited mobility, or serious medical conditions. Also, not ideal for young children or those seeking a relaxed, leisurely getaway.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The Brecon Beacons is known for its unpredictable weather. Be prepared for rain, wind, and sunshine, even in summer. Check the forecast before you go and pack accordingly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends, especially during peak season. Allow extra time for travel and consider parking at park-and-ride locations where available. Parking at Waterfall Country can be limited, arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for all activities, especially during peak season. Accommodation should also be booked well in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This trip requires a good level of fitness. You'll be hiking, climbing, and scrambling over uneven terrain. Be prepared for strenuous activity.
